IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE QUALITY ACUTE CARE HOSPITAL SERVICES
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO SERVE AND CARE FOR THE PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL AND SOCIAL WELL-BEING OF THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES
IRS990.Description: TO PROVIDE MEDICAL SERVICES, HEALTH EDUCATION, AND WELLNESS SERVICES INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO DENTAL, OBSTETRICS, SURGERY, PEDIATRICS, AND INTERNAL MEDICINE

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE HOSPITAL ADOPTED PROVISIONS OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD INTERPRETATION NO. 48 (FIN 48), ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES-AN INTERPRETATION OF FASB STATEMENT NO. 109, WHICH WAS SUBSEQUENTLY INCORPORATED INTO THE FASB ACCOUNTING CODIFICATION (ASC) TOPIC 740. THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS STANDARD HAD NO SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON THE HOSPITAL'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

LINE 2D: -------- RELATED ORGANIZATION'S REVENUE $ 580,337 SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES $ 32,589 RECLASS OF RENTAL EXPENSES $ 137 ----------- TOTAL $ 613,063 =========== LINE 4B: CONTRIBUTION $1,779,958 ----------- TOTAL $1,779,958 ===========
RELATED ORGANIZATION'S EXPENSES $ 17,164 SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES $ 32,589 RECLASS OF RENTAL EXPENSES $ 137 ---------- TOTAL $ 49,890 ==========

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CostingMethodUsed: THE COSTING METHODOLOGY USED TO CALCULATE THE AMOUNTS CONTAINED IN THE TABLE OF PART I, LINE 7, OF SCHEDULE H, IS A COST TO CHARGE RATIO.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.SubsidizedHealthServicesExpln: THE HOSPITAL INCLUDED $242,861 FROM A PHYSICIAN CLINIC.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PercentOfTotalExpenseExpln: THE AMOUNT OF BAD DEBT EXPENSE REMOVED FORM TOTAL EXPENSES FOR CALCULATING THE NET COMMUNITY BENEFIT EXPENSE PERCENTAGE WAS $669,226.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: THE HOSPITAL USED THE ACTUAL ACCOUNT BALANCE AMOUNTS WRITTEN OFF AND SENT TO COLLECTION AGENCIES (NO HOME HEALTH OR FFPC) OR WRITTEN OFF DUE TO BANKRUPTCIES FOR THE TOTAL ON LINE 2. LINE 3 IS THE AMOUNT OF ACCOUNT BALANCES WRITTEN OFF DUE TO BANKRUPTCIES. THE HOSPITAL REPORTS PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE FOR SERVICES RENDERED AT NET REALIZABLE AMOUNTS FROM THIRD-PARTY PAYERS, PATIENTS AND OTHERS. THE HOSPITAL PROVIDES AN ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS BASED UPON A REVIEW OF OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLES, HISTORICAL COLLECTION INFORMATION AND EXISTING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS. AS A SERVICE TO THE PATIENT, THE HOSPITAL BILLS THIRD-PARTY PAYERS DIRECTLY AND BILLS THE PATIENT WHEN THE PATIENT'S LIABILITY IS DETERMINED. PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE ARE DUE IN FULL WHEN BILLED. ACCOUNTS ARE CONSIDERED DELINQUENT AND SUBSEQUENTLY WRITTEN OFF AS BAD DEBTS BASED ON INDIVIDUAL CREDIT EVALUATION AND SPECIFIC CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE ACCOUNT.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: THE HOSPITAL'S SERVICE AREA IS APPROXIMATELY 21% MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES WHO PREFER TO GET THEIR MEDICAL CARE LOCALLY. 57% OF THE HOSPITAL'S REVENUE IS GENERATED BY THESE MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES. OUR CUSTOMER SERVICE SURVEYS RATE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL-FAIRFAX CONSISTENTLY OVER 90%, SHOWING THESE MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES APPRECIATE THE SERVICES THE HOSPITAL PROVIDES AND HOW THE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED. THE COSTING SOURCE WAS THE FY10 MEDICARE COST REPORT.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.DebtCollectionPolicy: COLLECTION POLICY STATES ALL UNINSURED AND INSURED PATIENTS ARE INFORMED ON THEIR FIRST STATEMENT OF SERVICES THAT COMMUNITY HOSPITAL HAS A GRANT PROGRAM (FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE) FOR THOSE WHO QUALIFY. THIS SAME TYPE OF 'ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE' INFORMATION IS ALSO IN THE PATIENT INFORMATION BROCHURES IN THE PATIENT ROOMS AND WAITING AREAS. PATIENTS MAY QUALIFY FOR A CHARITY DISCOUNT OR A MEDICALLY INDIGENT DISCOUNT, DEPENDING ON THEIR FINANCIAL SITUATION AND USING THE FEDERAL POVERTY GUIDELINES.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: THE HOSPITAL WILL BE DOING A COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESEMENT IN THE NEAR FUTURE BUT HAS NOT DONE ONE YET.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: COLLECTION POLICY STATES ALL UNINSURED AND INSURED PATIENTS ARE INFORMED ON THEIR FIRST STATEMENT OF SERVICES THAT COMMUNITY HOSPITAL HAS A GRANT PROGRAM (FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE) FOR THOSE WHO QUALIFY. THIS SAME TYPE OF 'ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE' INFORMATION IS ALSO IN THE PATIENT INFORMATION BROCHURES IN EVERY INPATIENT PATIENT ROOM AND IN THE WAITING AREAS AT ADMISSIONS, EMERGENCY ROOMS, AND OTHER OUTPATIENT WAITING AREAS. UNINSURED INPATIENTS ARE VISITED BY COLLECTIONS STAFF WHO EXPLAIN THE OPTIONS AVAILABLE, SUCH AS CHARITY CARE AND MEDICALLY INDIGENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, ASSISTANCE IN APPLYING FOR MEDICAID OR ANY OTHER FINANCIAL PROGRAM THE PATIENT NEEDS HELP APPLYING FOR. THIS SAME ASSISTANCE IS AVAILABLE FOR OUTPATIENTS. PATIENTS MAY QUALIFY FOR A CHARITY DISCOUNT OR A MEDICALLY INDIGENT DISCOUNT, DEPENDING ON THEIR FINANCIAL SITUATION AND USING THE FEDERAL POVERTY GUIDELINES.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: THE COMMUNITY SERVED BY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION IS MAINLY AGRICULTURAL-RELATED BUSINESSES WITH A DECREASING POPULATION AND A DECLINE IN 'MAIN STREET' BUSINESSES. MANY CONSTITUENTS TRAVEL A 30-MILE RADIUS TO WORK IN FACTORIES. 2009 UNEMPLOYMENT RATES FOR THE AREAS: ATCHISON COUNTY 7.4 (4.7 IN 2008); HOLT COUNTY 7.2 (5.0 IN 2008).
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityBuildingActivities: COMMUNITY HOSPITAL REACHES OUT TO OVER 200 WOMEN ON AN ANNUAL BASIS THROUGH A WOMEN'S HEALTH EVENT CALLED ME MARKET. HELD IN NOVEMBER EACH YEAR, THE ME MARKET FEATURES SHOPPING OPPORTUNITIES FOR WOMEN AS WELL AS HEALTH RELATED SPEAKERS AND FREE SCREENINGS. IN 2010, SPEAKERS ON TOPICS LIKE CARING FOR THE ELDERLY WERE OFFERED TO THE PUBLIC. FLU SHOTS, BLOOD PRESSURE CHECKS AND OTHER FREE SCREENINGS WERE ALSO OFFERED. IN FEBRUARY, COMMUNITY HOSPITAL OFFERS A FREE LUNCH TO THE COMMUNITY AND AN OPPORTUNITY FOR THEM TO ASK HEART HEALTH RELATED QUESTIONS TO ONE OF OUR CARDIOLOGISTS. FREE SCREENINGS AND DRAWINGS FOR MEMBERSHIPS TO GYMS ARE ALSO OFFERED TO THE PUBLIC. IN THE SPRING, COMMUNITY HOSPITAL FOCUSES ON CHILDREN'S HEALTH. OUR FIELD DAY OFFERS RACES AND ACTIVITIES FOR CHILDREN. HOSPITAL STAFF IS ON HAND TO TEACH CHILDREN ABOUT HEALTHY EATING HABITS, EXERCISE, AND THE DANGERS OF SMOKING. OVER SIXTY CHILDREN PARTICIPATED IN THIS 2010 EVENT. COMMUNITY HOSPITAL ALSO HOSTS PEDIATRIC ORIENTATION FOR AREA FIRST GRADERS. 90+ FIRST GRADERS JOIN HOSPITAL STAFF IN "ROLE PLAYING" A PATIENT AT THE HOSPITAL. STUDENTS LEARN WHAT GOES ON AT THEIR LOCAL HOSPITAL IN HOPES OF REDUCING THEIR FEAR UPON A VISIT LATER IN LIFE. IN SEPTEMBER OF EACH YEAR, COMMUNITY HOSPITAL HOSTS A FREE PROSTATE SCREENING (DIGITAL EXAM) AND A REDUCED PRICE PSA TEST TO MEN IN THE COMMUNITY. NEARLY 70 MEN PARTICIPATE IN THIS ANNUAL SCREENING. IN ADDITION TO THESE EVENTS, COMMUNITY HOSPITAL PUBLISHES A QUARTERLY NEWSLETTER WITH HEALTH RELATED INFORMATION THAT IS DISTRIBUTED TO AREA RESIDENTS. THE NEWSLETTER IS ACCOMPANIED BY REGULAR NEWSPAPER ARTICLES AND RADIO ADS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: COMMUNITY HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION ALLOWS AREA ORGANIZATIONS TO HOLD WEEKLY/MONTHLY MEETINGS IN ITS CONFERENCE ROOM, SUCH AS WEIGHT WATCHERS, KIWANIS, QUILT GUILD, AMBULANCE DISTRICT.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A AND SCHEDULE J, PART II
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE CEO COMPENSATION IS PAID THROUGH A MANAGEMENT CONTRACT WITH THE NEBRASKA MEDICAL CENTER (NMC), A RELATED ORGANIZATION. THE RELATED COMPENSATION PAID TO DIRECTORS IS FOR THEIR EMPLOYMENT WITH NMC, NOT FOR THEIR ROLE AS A DIRECTOR WITH THE HOSPITAL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: DELEGATION OF CONTROL OVER MANAGEMENT DUTIES
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMMUNITY HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION, INC. HOLDS A MANAGEMENT CONTRACT WITH THE NEBRASKA MEDICAL CENTER (NMC). NMC APPOINTS A CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER TO MANAGE DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM PREPARES AND REVIEWS THE FORM 990. THE 990 IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S ADMINISTRATION. ANY QUESTIONS AND CONCERNS THE ORGANIZATION'S ADMINISTRATION HAVE ARE ADDRESSED AND ANY CORRECTIONS OR CLARIFICATIONS THAT NEED TO BE MADE ARE MADE. THE 990 WITH ALL COMPLETED SCHEDULES IS THEN PROVIDED TO ALL VOTING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING THE 990.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION ANNUALLY OBTAINS WRITTEN AFFIRMATIONS FROM EACH OFFICER AND DIRECTOR AS TO THEIR COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. IF A DISCLOSURE OCCURS, THE MATTER IS VOTED ON BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. IF A MAJORITY VOTE OCCURS THEN THE DISCLOSURE IS CONSIDERED A CONFLICT. THE CONFLICTED INDIVIDUAL MAY NOT VOTE OR PARTICIPATE IN THE MATTERS INVOLVING THE CONFLICT.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINES 15A & 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION USES COMPARABILITY DATA TO DETERMINE THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO AND OTHER OFFICERS. THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE COMPENSATION OF THE OTHER OFFICERS IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
